fallbackNotice: Temporarily showing English content while we complete this translation.

packages.name: 4-session starter
packages.scope: Decision scorecard, tiny tests, basic portfolio/CV review.

packages.name: Single session
packages.scope: One decision or interview prep with a clear action note.
packages.price_note: Good for assessment centre or first interviews.

policies.title: No guarantees
policies.body: We support experiments; outcomes depend on your effort and timing.

checklist: 50–60 minutes available online; UK hours workable.
A target role or field (even if rough).
Willing to run one micro-experiment between sessions.
Latest CV/LinkedIn link ready to share.
what_to_prepare: Your LinkedIn URL or recent CV (PDF).
Two class/work projects you can explain in 60–90 seconds.
Short list of target roles/companies or constraints.
Top 3 questions you want answered in the first two sessions.
signals: You value clear, UK-relevant guidance over hype.
You prefer tiny steps that build confidence and proof.
You can keep a weekly cadence with short reviews.

process.title: Process & pace
process.description: A six to eight week sprint with optional monthly check-ins as you transition into your role.
steps: Map strengths → small proof: skills, projects, outcomes.
UK CV/LinkedIn alignment: clear bullets, concrete verbs, results.
Portfolio or samples: one page, one story, one link.
Track → review → adjust: keep steps small and visible.
process.note: Optional aftercare check-ins help you translate offers into confident starts.

sections.title: Scope & Fit
paragraphs: This is coaching, not placement, therapy, or legal advice.
We focus on proof points, story clarity, preparation, and cadence.

sections.title: Confidentiality
paragraphs: Confidential by default; minimal notes; deletion on request.
Quality supervision may use anonymised patterns without identifiers.

sections.title: Scheduling & Rescheduling
paragraphs: 24 hours’ notice to reschedule; late changes count as used.

sections.title: Fees & Invoicing
paragraphs: Fees in GBP; invoiced per block or as agreed.

sections.title: Data & Records
paragraphs: Minimum data kept for sessions and invoices.
Copy/deletion requests respected within legal limits.

sections.title: Fair Use & Boundaries
paragraphs: Light check-ins are fine; heavy review/done-for-you is out of scope.
We do not contact employers on your behalf.

items.q: Do you place graduates into jobs?
items.a: No. Coaching is not placement. We help you produce UK-relevant proof and clear stories; you apply and track.
You remain the author. We coach structure, clarity, and UK norms; we co-edit in Google Docs.

items.q: What if I have no “real experience”?
items.a: We turn coursework, volunteering, and small projects into evidence with outcomes and links.
Usually 30–60 minutes weekly (one micro-experiment or edit pass). Keep it small and visible.
Yes. Confidential by default; minimal notes; deletion on request. See boundaries.

items.q: Do you contact employers for me?
items.a: No. We help with outreach scripts and confidence; you contact directly.
24-hour notice to reschedule; late changes count as used. Delivered sessions are non-refundable.

cases.title: Composite coaching glimpses
cases.description: Stories merged from graduates and early-career professionals to keep individuals anonymous.

items.title: Too many choices, no criteria
items.context: Three sectors look appealing but overwhelm decisions.
items.coaching_moves: Built decision scorecard; set 2-week micro-test per sector.
items.shift: Made next pick using data rather than mood.
items.disclaimer: Illustrative and anonymised; outcomes are not promised.

items.title: Interview stories flat
items.context: Projects sound generic; feedback: 'lack of impact'.
items.coaching_moves: Refined two STAR stories; rehearsed follow-ups; trimmed jargon.
items.shift: Stories felt concrete and paced; fewer ramble moments.
items.disclaimer: Illustrative and anonymised; outcomes are not promised.

items.title: Portfolio without context
items.coaching_moves: Added problem-goal-result captions; linked constraints; ordered by learning.
items.shift: Reviewers grasped thinking, not just visuals.
items.disclaimer: Illustrative and anonymised; outcomes are not promised.

items: Turn scattered efforts into a coherent story with visible evidence.
Weekly cadence; micro-experiments between sessions (coffee chats, mini-projects).
Portfolio/CV that shows outcomes and proof, not just course lists.
Interview rehearsal for clarity and fit—no scripts, no hacks.
Simple pricing; pause between blocks; confidentiality by default.
